title: Here is a list of 20 articles up to 2021 that focus on methods for aggregating and learning from multiple annotations in datasets
Learning from crowds
container-title: Journal of Machine Learning Research

title: This paper presents a probabilistic model for learning from multiple annotators with varying expertise
Maximum likelihood estimation of observer error-rates using the EM algorithm
container-title: Journal of the Royal Statistical Society

title: A seminal work on using the EM algorithm to estimate error rates of multiple annotators
Cheap and fast—but is it good? Evaluating non-expert annotations for natural language tasks
container-title: Proceedings of the 2008 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing

title: This paper evaluates the quality of non-expert annotations and methods to aggregate them effectively
The multidimensional wisdom of crowds
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: Discusses a model for aggregating annotations across multiple dimensions
Whose vote should count more: Optimal integration of labels from labelers of unknown expertise
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: Proposes a method to weigh annotations based on the inferred expertise of the annotators
Learning from the wisdom of crowds by minimax entropy
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: Introduces a minimax entropy principle for learning from multiple annotators
Iterative learning for reliable crowdsourcing systems
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: Presents an iterative algorithm for improving the reliability of crowdsourced data
Variational inference for crowdsourcing
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: Discusses a variational inference approach to model the reliability of multiple annotators
Bayesian classifier combination
container-title: Proceedings of the Fifteenth International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

title: Proposes a Bayesian approach to combine classifiers trained by different annotators
Community-based Bayesian aggregation models for crowdsourcing
container-title: Proceedings of the 23rd International Conference on World Wide Web

title: Introduces community-based models for aggregating annotations in crowdsourcing
Get another label? Improving data quality and data mining using multiple, noisy labelers
container-title: Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining

title: Discusses strategies for improving data quality by using multiple annotators
Crowdsourcing label quality: A theoretical analysis
container-title: Proceedings of the 24th International Joint Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: Provides a theoretical analysis of label quality in crowdsourcing
Who said what: Modeling individual labelers improves classification
container-title: Proceedings of the 32nd AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: Explores models that account for individual annotator behavior to improve classification
Truth inference in crowdsourcing: Is the problem solved?
container-title: Proceedings of the VLDB Endowment

title: Reviews and evaluates existing truth inference methods in crowdsourcing
Error rate bounds and iterative weighted majority voting for crowdsourcing
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: Proposes error rate bounds and iterative algorithms for weighted majority voting
A Bayesian model for learning from crowds with binary outcomes
container-title: IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering

title: Presents a Bayesian model for aggregating binary annotations from crowds
Bayesian classifier combination
container-title: Proceedings of the Fifteenth International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

title: Discusses Bayesian methods for combining classifiers trained with different annotations
Truth inference in crowdsourcing: Is the problem solved?
container-title: Proceedings of the VLDB Endowment

title: Reviews the state of truth inference methods in crowdsourcing
Variational inference for crowdsourcing
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: Introduces a variational inference approach for modeling annotator reliability
Deep learning from crowds
container-title: Proceedings of the Thirty-Second AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: Explores deep learning techniques for learning from crowdsourced annotations

These articles cover a range of methods, from probabilistic models and Bayesian approaches to deep learning techniques, providing a comprehensive overview of the field of aggregating and learning from multiple annotations
